solution.p: The quality control manager believes that the new method results in a different variation in the weights of the capsules (in mg). The average and the standard deviation of the data are respectively 99.16 mg and 1.253 mg. The average and the standard deviation of the data are respectively 99.28 mg and 1.497 mg.

Use a 10 significance level to test the claim that the standard deviation of the capsule weights in the production line 1 is less than the standard deviation of the capsule weights in the production line 2. If normality plots are not provided assume that the samples are from normal populations.

Procedure: In the question, look for the keywords such as mean/average, proportion/percentage, variance/standard deviation! In this case, we have "standard deviation of the capsule weights in the production line" and two populations, thus we are going to perform Two Variances F Hypothesis Test.
Assumptions (select everything that applies): For Two Variances F Hypothesis Test,

ul.li: the samples must be simple random and independent, and
for each sample, the population must be normal;
the assumption "population standard deviations are unknown" is not necessary, but since it is technically satisfied we must select it as well.
